alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 2:17PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cochise County through 300 PM MST... At 217 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Pearce-Sunsites, or 15 miles south of Willcox, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kansas Settlement. This includes Route 186 between mile markers 336 and 341. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
